# ğŸ‰ Rust Learning Vault v0.1.0 - Initial Public Release

**Release Date:** October 27, 2025

We're thrilled to announce the first public release of the **Rust Learning Vault** - a comprehensive, Obsidian-based knowledge management system designed to help you master the Rust programming language! ğŸ¦€

## ğŸŒŸ What is Rust Learning Vault?

Rust Learning Vault is a structured, interconnected learning system that combines:

- ğŸ“š **Organized Knowledge** - 10 well-structured folders for systematic learning
- ğŸ”— **Bidirectional Linking** - Connect concepts and build a knowledge graph
- ğŸ“ **Ready-to-Use Templates** - Quick-start your learning notes
- ğŸŒ **WebAssembly Focus** - Special resources for Rust + WASM development
- ğŸŒ **Bilingual Support** - Full documentation in English and ä¸­æ–‡
- ğŸ¤ **Community-Driven** - Open for contributions from learners worldwide

## âœ¨ Key Features

### ğŸ“– Complete Learning Structure

```
rust_vault/
â”œâ”€â”€ 00-Index/           # Your starting point - MOC and guides
â”œâ”€â”€ 01-Fundamentals/    # Core Rust concepts
â”œâ”€â”€ 02-Advanced/        # Advanced topics
â”œâ”€â”€ 03-Std-Library/     # Standard library reference
â”œâ”€â”€ 04-Ecosystem/       # Crates and tools
â”œâ”€â”€ 05-Patterns/        # Design patterns and best practices
â”œâ”€â”€ 06-Projects/        # Hands-on projects and guides
â”œâ”€â”€ 07-Snippets/        # Code snippet library
â”œâ”€â”€ 08-Daily/           # Daily learning journal
â”œâ”€â”€ 09-QA/              # Questions and answers
â””â”€â”€ 10-Templates/       # Note templates
```

### ğŸ¯ Learning Resources Included

- **Rust Web Projects Guide** - 10 curated projects (5 beginner + 5 production-level)
- **WebAssembly Comprehensive Guide** - Complete WASM learning path
- **WASM Quick Reference** - Instant lookup guide
- **Learning Roadmap** - Structured path from beginner to advanced
- **Setup Guide** - Complete development environment setup

### ğŸ“ Three Powerful Templates

1. **Concept Template** - For learning new Rust concepts
2. **Daily Learning Template** - Track your daily progress
3. **Code Snippet Template** - Save reusable code examples

### ğŸŒ Bilingual Documentation

- **English** - Complete documentation for international learners

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md/) (Free)
- [Git](https://git-scm.com/) (Optional, for version control)

### Installation

**Option 1: Clone with Git**

```bash
git clone https://github.com/Desperado1001/rust-learning-vault.git
cd rust-learning-vault/rust_vault
```

**Option 2: Download ZIP**

1. Click the "Code" button on GitHub
2. Select "Download ZIP"
3. Extract the archive
4. Navigate to the `rust_vault` folder

### Open in Obsidian

1. Launch Obsidian
2. Click "Open folder as vault"
3. Select the `rust_vault` folder
4. Start with `00-Index/Rust-MOC.md`

### First Steps

1. ğŸ“– Read `00-Index/Rust-MOC.md` - Your command center
2. ğŸ—ºï¸ Review `00-Index/Learning-Roadmap.md` - Plan your journey
3. âš™ï¸ Follow `00-Index/Setup-Guide.md` - Set up Rust environment
4. ğŸ“ Create your first daily note using the template
5. ğŸ”— Start building your knowledge graph!

---

## ğŸ“ Learning Paths

### For Absolute Beginners

1. Start with `01-Fundamentals/Ownership.md`
2. Work through the Learning Roadmap sequentially
3. Use daily notes to track progress
4. Practice with code snippets

### For Intermediate Learners

1. Jump to `02-Advanced-Concepts/`
2. Explore the Rust Web Projects guide
3. Build projects from `06-Projects/`
4. Contribute your own notes!

### For Web Developers

1. Check out `06-Projects/Rust-Web-Projects.md`
2. Dive into WebAssembly resources
3. Use WASM Quick Reference as you code
4. Share your projects with the community

---

### Core Plugins (Enable in Settings)

- Daily Notes
- Templates
- Graph View
- Backlinks

### Community Plugins (Install from Community)

- **Calendar** â­â­â­ - Visual daily notes navigation
- **Dataview** â­â­â­ - Query and display data dynamically
- **Templater** â­â­â­ - Advanced template features
- **Tasks** â­â­ - Task management
- **Kanban** â­â­ - Project tracking
- **Excalidraw** â­â­ - Drawing and diagrams

## ğŸ¤ Contributing

We welcome contributions from the community! Here's how you can help:

### Ways to Contribute

- ğŸ“ **Add Content** - Write concept notes, tutorials, guides
- ğŸ’¾ **Share Code** - Contribute code snippets and examples
- ğŸ› **Report Issues** - Help us improve by reporting bugs
- ğŸ’¡ **Suggest Features** - Share your ideas for improvements
- ğŸŒ **Translate** - Help make content available in more languages
- ğŸ“¢ **Spread the Word** - Share with fellow Rust learners

### Quick Start for Contributors

1. Read [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/Desperado1001/rust-learning-vault/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
2. Fork the repository
3. Create a feature branch
4. Make your changes
5. Submit a pull request

We have a friendly, welcoming community and detailed guidelines to help you get started!

## ğŸŠ Special Notes for v0.1.0

This is the **initial public release** - the foundation upon which we'll build an amazing learning resource together!

### What This Means

- ğŸ‰ **First Milestone** - The beginning of our journey
- ğŸŒ± **Growing Project** - We're just getting started
- ğŸ¤ **Community Building** - Help us shape the future
- ğŸ“š **Core Foundation** - Solid structure in place
- ğŸš€ **Ready to Use** - Fully functional from day one

### Known Limitations

- Content is still being expanded (that's where you come in!)
- Some folders have placeholder notes
- We're always improving based on feedback

**Your feedback and contributions will make v0.2.0 even better!**
